intro: Capurodendron aubrevillei, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a member of the Bignoniaceae family. It is a deciduous tree characterized by its striking orange to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has pinnate leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Native to tropical Africa, it thrives in warm, humid climates. Its ornamental value makes it popular in landscaping and horticulture.
